Sentencas: Assembly of a planar solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) or solid electrolyzer (SOE) stack involves the lamination of cells and interconnect plates under an applied load.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: In most designs a pattern of ribs on the interconnector makes contact with a porous ceramic current collector layer on the air side.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: These localized contacts are regions of increased stress on the cells and can cause damage if the stresses become too large.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: In this paper the mechanical response of an anode-supported cell to localized loads from interconnector ribs is simulated.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: The simulations show that the critical stress for initiating and propagating a crack in the electrolyte (approximate to 300MPa for a 10m thick electrolyte) is reached when the interconnector displacement reaches 20m (after touching the cathode) with reduced support, or 30m when in an oxidized state.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: The difference is due to the lower stiffness of the reduced support.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: The residual compressive stress in the electrolyte layer has a major protective effect for the electrolyte.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: It is concluded that fracture is very unlikely for a geometrically perfect contact, but if the contact is non-uniform due to manufacturing variability in the contact plate or cell, local displacements >approximate to 20m can be dangerous.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics

Sentencas: The simulations are used in an example of contacting geometry optimization.
Titulo: Numerical Study of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell Contacting Mechanics
